item.title: Classes Constructors and objects in Javascript
item.description: A class in programming is a blueprint for creating objects that defines a set of properties and methods. Classes provide a way to encapsulate data and behavior in a single entity, making it easier to reason about complex systems and to share code between objects with similar properties and methods.

item.title: Compositing in Blender
item.description: Compositing for animation and VFX is a critical part of the pipeline. In fact often it is the part of the pipeline that gets you the last 10-20% for whatever project you are working on.

item.title: Introduction to Coding
item.description: Slides Introduction to the history of mathematics and computing: Brief overview of the history of mathematics and how it has evolved over time.

item.title: Iterators in Javascript
item.description: Iterators in JavaScript are objects that define a sequence of values and a next() method to access them. The next() method returns an object with two properties: value (the current item in the sequence) and done (a boolean indicating whether the iteration has finished).

item.title: Javascript Loops and Arrays
item.description: One critical piece of programming is learning to work with loops and arrays or other sets of data. Loops in programming allow you to repeat a block of code multiple times.

item.title: Modeling Techniques
item.description: Overview of Modeling Methodologies Polygonal modeling is a 3D computer graphics technique used to create 3D models by manipulating individual polygons (typically triangles, quads, or ngons) and their vertices.

item.title: Modifiers in Blender
item.description: Overview In Blender, modifiers are tools that allow you to alter and modify objects in a non-destructive manner. They are like virtual “layers” of changes that you can apply to a base object without permanently altering its original geometry.

item.title: Sculpting in Blender
item.description: Sculpting is the process of digitally manipulating a 3D model using specialized software to create organic or freeform shapes, textures, and details.

item.title: Shading and Rendering in Blender
item.description: Rendering What is Rendering? Rendering in the context of computer graphics usually refers to the process of taking some type of data and turning it into a final image.

item.title: Texturing in Blender
item.description: Setting Things Up ![[notes/attachments/warning-icon-1.png|50]] First it’s important to make sure you’re model is correctly UV unwrapped. Next, it’s important to keep project management in mind for a texture painting process.

item.title: Togology in CG Lesson
item.description: [[notes/3D-Modeling/blender/assignments/topology/Topology-Assignment-Instructions]] Understanding topology is a critical part of being a competent 3D artist. Topology is the fundamental structure of your 3D data works and relates with itself.
